A careless intern generated multiple RSA keys using the same prime. Recover the message hidden in 5727599480514184690942524484109982394155984023201571375891516542795449113523670699695482874502334158092599473431354079795074306125313540617370138163016885 by exploiting this repeated prime flaw.

The flag format is flag{...}
n=5832582172082219021123337082621941575327948177993928843051250167207761164930939616384625181900585776783928538550205474070116605749687314049361726848475289, e=1742579001976118919529512524438092699520291228801437236469346295937790677860139300243082412741040298203580063354518474154708075004431982250473089406960557

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{r6yuc3lb}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 5727599480514184690942524484109982394155984023201571375891516542795449113523670699695482874502334158092599473431354079795074306125313540617370138163016885
vulnerability: repeated primes
hint: The RSA modulus n is a perfect square. This often indicates a repeated prime usage vulnerability.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=5832582172082219021123337082621941575327948177993928843051250167207761164930939616384625181900585776783928538550205474070116605749687314049361726848475289, e=1742579001976118919529512524438092699520291228801437236469346295937790677860139300243082412741040298203580063354518474154708075004431982250473089406960557
extra_info: p=76371343919576399065697871543167155642079554446615774475207398554871152712517, q=76371343919576399065697871543167155642079554446615774475207398554871152712517, Ï†(n)=5832582172082219021123337082621941575327948177993928843051250167207761164930786873696786029102454381040842204238921314961223374200736899252251984543050256
subtype: repeated_prime_usage
